title: Day 962
content:
# Day 962

Today, I went to the fair, and I couldn't help but reflect on a few things. The experience, though fun, brought some harsh realities to mind. I understand that prices are often inflated at events like these, but the costs were truly staggering. It makes me wonder how families are managing to get by, especially as our financial situation seems more unsustainable with each passing day.

![](https://miro.medium.com/1*fJnSKKNgx9xTSHffeeF5EA.png)

Despite these concerns, I do find hope in some of the leaders we've elected. Figures like Elon Musk, Howard Lutnick, RFK Jr., Tulsi Gabbard, and even Donald Trump appear committed to revitalizing America. I believe that increasing domestic energy production, such as drilling, could bring relief to consumers by lowering prices. Additionally, the idea of establishing a strategic Bitcoin reserve to help back the dollar is intriguing and could be a forward-thinking move to strengthen our currency.

While our options seem promising in some ways, the sense of looming uncertainty still lingers in the background. Only time will tell how this all unfolds.

![](https://miro.medium.com/0*518-tsGScy7zF70f)

True^

11/8/24

Conor Jay Chepenik
